label: 佩飾
本: Exhibition of Shōsō-in Treasures , The 55th  . Nara National Museum . 2003
説明文: Haishoku are small objects hung from the waist on cords for ornamental as well as functional purposes. Such decorative accessories include carpentry tools, such as penknives, files, gimlets, and rulers, as well as pouches, small boxes, and precious stones. The hanging cords include both flat and round braids and tapestry weaves.
